info.name: Stedi Starter Pack
info.description:
# Stedi 

A flexible platform for building powerful EDI systems

## Getting started
1. [Create a free Stedi account](https://terminal.stedi.com/sign-up) to access Terminal.
2. [Create an API Key](https://www.stedi.com/docs/authentication)
3. Paste your key into the header replacing `<STEDI_API_KEY>`.
4. Try out a request

request.description:
Translate between supported EDI formats (JSON and EDI X12)

Review the *body* of POST call for guidance on how to use fields. If you have a specific use case in mind, go to examples where you'll find how to: 

* translate EDI to JEDI (JSON EDI)
* translate JSON to EDI
* translate and validate against a specific mapping guide

**Notes** 
* it's okay if your EDI files contain `\n` LF or `\r\n` CLRF, they will parse successfully.
* browse our library of [EDI mapping guides](https://edi.stedi.com/mapping-guides) and use the guide version ID to validate EDI via the API

response.name: error validation w. Mapping Guide
